text: South Dakota School of Mines & Technology
SD Mines is a STEM university, with curriculum that allows you to jump into your major from day one. At Mines, we expect you to break things, build things, explore your passions, and invent tomorrow.
Gain access to renowned faculty, high-tech facilities, challenging projects, and the resources you need to advance your career and research what matters - here and around the globe.

SD Mines was ranked as the #1 engineering university in the country by College Factual. Our affordable price, competitive scholarships, high placement rate and starting salary make our university a great return on investment.
Incoming freshman need to be accepted to SD Mines by January 15 to be considered for scholarships.
South Dakota Mines Physics Students Win National Recognition

The South Dakota Mines chapter of the Society of Physics Students (SPS) has won an Outstanding Chapter Award from the SPS National Office. This is the fourth year in a row the chapter has been recognized for its excellence.
Women Student Entrepreneurs Take Home Top Prizes in 2019 “Shark Tank” Style Competition

The sixth annual CEO Business Plan Competition at the South Dakota School of Mines & Technology wrapped up Saturday with female students winning all but one of the top prizes. The winners took home more than $7,000 in total prize money that can be used toward their business ideas.
Nanopareil: Where Tiny Fibers Reap Huge Rewards

The technology at the heart of Nanopareil was developed at SD Mines. It revolves around nanofibers a thousand times smaller than a human hair, but its potential impact on the pharmaceutical industry could be massive.
SD Mines Again Ranks as the Best Engineering School in the Country for Return on Investment

In its 2020 rankings, the organization College Factual   places South Dakota School of Mines & Technology as the best   engineering school for the money out of 302 similar institutions across   the United States.

100  student clubs and organizations offer opportunities to meet new people and learn new things, and begin friendships that can last a lifetime. Explore the options at our Mines Link website.
Our summer camps are designed to be fun and hands-on, and are for high school students (grades 9 - 12). Registration is available now for our 2020 Camps!

SD Mines continues its partnership with South Dakota Public Broadcasting and Hay Camp Brewing Company to host the STEAM Café, a series of free informal talks on topics ranging from cutting edge research to history.

The SD Mines virtual tour captures our unique campus using vibrant imagery, VR360 tours, and video and allows you to enjoy 360° panoramic views of our beautiful campus from the convenience of your own computer or mobile device.

At the Office of Marketing and Communications, our portfolio is broad. Our efforts and activities help to recruit students, faculty, and staff; support  fundraising activities; provide recognition for achievements of our campus community; and identify opportunities for the  university to work more closely with the city, region and state where we reside.  The Office of Marketing and Communications is located in the University Relations Studio (next door to the Music building, across the street from EE/Physics).
Request MC assistance with marketing and communications projects
Download approved logos for use in publications & promotion
Follow university guidelines to stay consistent with our branding
Downloadable templates help you quickly produce branded documents
Find a treasure trove of SD Mines photos already online.
If you need help or have questions, contact a member of the Marketing and Communications department.

Marketing and Communications produces recruiting materials, the Hardrock Magazine, the monthly Legacy News, and more - and helps other SD Mines groups produce a variety of printed and online materials.

The university website tells our story to the outside world and aids in many internal communications and processes.  MC also manages the university social media platforms, handles digital and email marketing.
Marketing and Communications works with media relations, public relations, government relations and outreach to our geographic community and to the science and engineering community.
About the Marketing and Communications Job Request System
Use our online Job Request form when you have a project you need MC to do for you, or help you with. (The form requires you to log in using your network passwords). You can request help with:

Our physical education classes will help you compete in the classroom and on the field     with a variety of health and fitness classes designed to spark a healthy, active lifestyle for  students of every interest and ability level.

Between classes and labs, roommates and exams, college can be stressful. Our classes will     help you reduce stress and blow off steam. Tune in, chill out and shape up with our yoga, Zumba and rock climbing classes. Or challenge your friends to a game of Ultimate Frisbee,          flag football or soccer with our intramural and club sports.

Looking for an adrenaline rush? Grab your board and carve up the ice on a tricked-out half     pipe or shred the slopes with our Ski & Snowboarding Club. Or join the Hardrocker Climbing Club and scale the Cathedral Spires, towering granite pillars nestled in the heart          of the Needles. If mountain biking or backpacking is your thing, explore more than 6,000     miles of trails winding through forests, over mountain peaks and under waterfalls with the     Cycling Club.
We also offer health classes to get you eating right, fend off the "freshmen 15" and develop     healthy habits for a richer life.
